TopicTitle: [1.12.x] Cryogenic Engines: Liquid Hydrogen and Methane Rockets! (Jan 22, 2022)

Articles.Content: Using MFT, is the Cryogenic tank type supposed to be available? All I have is default
Hey [@Nertea](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/83952-nertea/) just wanted to let you know that I really appreciate your work
Does anyone know if any mod patch exisits for Cyo Engines that replaces Oxidizer by LqdOxygen?

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> Does anyone know if any mod patch exisits for Cyo Engines that replaces Oxidizer by LqdOxygen?
> 

Pretty sure he includes a patch in the mod, in the extras folder

> 
> 
> 30 minutes ago, Nnimrod said:
> 
> 
> Pretty sure he includes a patch in the mod, in the extras folder
> 

Nope, the extra content on contains a fix which modifies the Isp. there is no patch which fixes the volumes of hydrogen on the tanks and replaces Oxidizer by LqdOxygen

> 
> 
> Just now, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> Nope, the extra content on contains a fix which modifies the Isp. there is no patch which fixes the volumes of hydrogen on the tanks and replaces Oxidizer by LqdOxygen
> 

I'm sorry, I misread your first post.
Do these work good With Real fuels and RSS?

> 
> 
> 30 minutes ago, Dermeister said:
> 
> 
> Do these work good With Real fuels and RSS?
> 

There are configs for them in RF Stockalike and RO, yes.  No idea if they work "well"

It's worth noting that your setup might actually be harder than RO - the engines and fuel tanks will have realistic masses but everything else, e.g. command pods, still have their stock masses (unless you have some other mod to change that), so they will be overweight compared to the real things.

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, blowfish said:
> 
> 
> It's worth noting that your setup might actually be harder than RO - the engines and fuel tanks will have realistic masses but everything else, e.g. command pods, still have their stock masses (unless you have some other mod to change that), so they will be overweight compared to the real things.
> 

Yea probably. I don't wan to use RO because it's to much realisem. I don't want ot use lfie support and I don't like how it upscales the command pods and make the kerbals look Tiny. But I love the size of the earth ect. So i'm not sure what to do other than roll with Procedural parts and RF.

Normally I play in 64k but I wanted to give earth a try. SO any suggestions other than using RO is welcomed!

![ksE9xdZ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ksE9xdZ.jpg)

Atleast I got this to nearly orbit >\_> mind you the cargo is a probe core with an antenna and a lil bit of rcs fuel... >\_< lol

You could also try SMURFF, which changes the masses of many things to be real-ish.  Not 100% sure it works well with RF but I think there's a good chance it will.

Some posts related directly to SMURFF have been moved to the SMURFF thread, as requested:

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/117992-105-11-smurff-simple-module-adjustments-for-real-ish-fuel-mass-fractions-13-2015-mar-17/&do=embed&embedComment=2578422&embedDo=findComment"></iframe>

Update!

- KSP 1.1.2
- Update bundled B9PartSwitch
- Update bundled CRP
- Fix switchable tank mass and cost issues

We may of course have some remaining bugs but I think things are good. Thank [@Kerbas_ad_astra](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/126593-kerbas_ad_astra/) for getting me on the path to fixifying the switchy patch.

These work like a charm.

I used to run a RealFuels setup with lots of bells and whistles, but even though there were so many fuel options for so many engines, I always found I was using Kerosene+LOx or LH2+LOx. So much wasted complexity (from my PoV). Having these installed in a stock(fuel) build is so much neater ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") Plus neat extra engines! Looking forward to unlocking your atomics too.

Great mod(s)

I love these engines! They're really shining in carreer since you get the smaller ones nice and early and they really help with building lighter and more efficient low tech vehicles. Light enough to lift up to 20km using balloons even ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") Boiloff means you cannot use these engines on long voyages without active cooling, but that's a good balance. 

Thanks for updating! The jitter with symmetry is fixed!

One thing though, I noticed that the engine exhaust is blue but the engines emit a red glow (running realplume and enginelight). Is this intended and some sort of real life effect, or is this an error in some config file?

Just saw the NFT update and thought, "no way he did CryoEngines too, the man is only human" but lo and behold it is done. 

Real reason I'm posting is just in case you didn't know SpaceDock has duplicate CryoEngine posts: one for 1.1 and one for 1.1.2.

~~Awesome job. What is the easiest way to convert these engines so they run on LiquidFuel and Oxidizer?~~

~~(This is for stock KSP and I'd like to balance the engines for running on LFO)~~

Found the MM patch. Guess I skimmed past it too fast when I first downloaded this pack.
